definition: to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
kjvTranslation: appoint, argue, chasten, convince, correct(-ion), daysman, dispute, judge, maintain, plead, reason (together), rebuke, reprove(-r), surely, in any wise.

translations.cs: mít pravdu (tj. mít pravdu); vzájemně, argumentovat; kauzálně, rozhodnout, ospravedlnit nebo odsoudit
